entries.title: Cubs run into bizarre triple play against Giants: 'Every day, you see something new'
entries.summary: <p>SCOTTSDALE, Ariz. – The inning was bizarre even by spring training standards.</p><p>The <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/cubs" >Cubs</a>’ 4-2 loss Sunday to the Giants began with a literal emergency alarm, running through parts of <b>Matt Shaw</b> and <b>Alex Bregmans</b>’ at-bats – It was definitely spring training, you know?” Bregman said – before spiraling into a triple play.</p><p>“I was confused about the fire drill, and then there’s three outs,” Cubs starting pitcher <b>Colin Rea</b> said. “And I’m like, ‘I don’t don’t know what just happened, but here we go.’”</p><p>With Cubs Shaw on second base and Bregman on first after both drawing walks, <b>Seiya Suzuki</b> blooped a single into shallow right field. Chaos ensued.</p><p>Giants second baseman <b>Luis Arraez</b> barehanded the ball on the bounce and tossed it home, prompting Suzuki to race for second. Giants first baseman <b>Rafael Devers</b> cut off the throw and fired.</p><p>One out.</p><p>Shaw had stopped in his tracks around third, while Bregman kept his head down and ran. They ended up on the same base.</p><p>"I thought I got a good read off the bat," Bregman said, "and then I should have ran a little bit more with my head up."</p><p>Giants shortstop <b>Willy Adames</b> ran over, tagged both runners, and handed the ball to third baseman <b>Matt Chapman</b>.</p><p>“I knew that, since I was the trail runner, I was out,” Bregman said. “But I’ve got to do a better job of just staying on the base, clarifying that.”</p><p>Two outs.</p><p>As Bregman headed to the dugout, correct in his assessment of the play, Shaw had a brief conversation with third-base coach <b>Quintin Berry</b>. Shaw stepped off the base, pulling off his sliding mitt and helmet as he talked. Chapman, still holding the ball, tagged him.</p><p>Three outs.</p><p>“I don’t know what happened,” Adames told Giants reporters. “That’s the beauty of baseball, I guess. Every day, you see something new.”</p><p>Said Bregman: “We'll learn from it.”</p><h3>Long set to see doctor</h3><p>The Cubs hope that<a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/cubs/2026/02/21/how-tokyo-series-prepared-cubs-matthew-boyd-for-wbc-ramp-up" > first baseman <b>Jonathon Long</b>’s left elbow sprain </a>isn’t serious enough to force him to withdraw from the World Baseball Classic, manager <b>Craig Counsell</b> said.</p><p>Long, a non-roster invitee, sustained the sprain Saturday in a collision Saturday during the Cubs’ game against the Rangers.</p><p>The Cubs shut him down from baseball activities Sunday, and he’s set to see a doctor Monday.</p><p>“He's sore today, and there's some swelling there today,” Counsell said. “But if it's just that, then, we're probably at two, three days [off] here.”</p><p>Long was scheduled to leave Cubs camp this week to join Team Chinese Taipei for the WBC.</p><h3>Gold for USA</h3><p>The Cubs were gathered in their clubhouse Sunday morning, with the TVs turned to the men’s hockey Olympic gold medal game between the United States and Canada, when Jack Hughes’ “golden goal” delivered the victory to the stars and stripes.</p><p>“We were all fired up,” said Bregman, who will be representing the US in the WBC this year. “We were going crazy in the clubhouse when we scored.”</p><p>Can that be replicated in the upcoming baseball tournament?</p><p>“Let's do it, let's go win,” Bregman said. “USA, baby.”<br></p>
entries.author: Maddie Lee

entries.title: Letter carrier union kicks off bargaining season with rally: 'First-class service deserves first-class pay'
entries.summary: <p>More than 100 workers with the National Association of Letter Carriers kicked off bargaining for their next contract Sunday with a rally, calling for fair wages and worker protections at the local branch’s Bronzeville headquarters. They were joined by Gov. JB Pritzker.</p><p>It comes after a year of attacks on federal workers' unions from the Trump administration, including the cancellation of several standing contracts.</p><p>The group is pushing for higher pay, a higher annual uniform allowance and safety measures for postal workers in the field in this new round of bargaining, which is expected to begin Wednesday, according to Elise Foster, president of NALC Branch 11.</p><p>Foster, a 30-year letter carrier from Pilsen, said postal workers often have to save up for years to get adequate uniforms to work outdoors through the city’s seasons. She said many union members are also concerned about safety after mail carrier Octavia Redmond was <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/crime/2024/10/01/boy-15-charged-with-fatally-shooting-postal-worker-octavia-redmond-west-pullman" target="_blank" ><u>fatally shot two years ago</u></a>.</p><p>“These are some of the top key items even just to retain employees,” Foster said. “No one do what we do, the way we do it, that’s why first-class service deserves first-class pay. … We have to deliver ourselves back home to our families.”</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item" data-crop=""> <figure class="Figure"><a class="AnchorLink" id="image-ff0000" name="image-ff0000"></a> <picture data-crop="medium"> <source type="image/webp" width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/8f6f124/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6000x3367+0+316/resize/490x275!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fd2%2F2c%2Fe25794db40b1a18d19ecd18f2eb1%2Fnalcrally-260223-05.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/18f24ba/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6000x3367+0+316/resize/980x550!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fd2%2F2c%2Fe25794db40b1a18d19ecd18f2eb1%2Fnalcrally-260223-05.jpg 2x" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <source width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/8b90d1e/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6000x3367+0+316/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fd2%2F2c%2Fe25794db40b1a18d19ecd18f2eb1%2Fnalcrally-260223-05.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <img class="Image" alt="Gov. JB Pritzker raises his fist next to Elise Foster, president of NALC Branch 11, at a rally kicking off bargaining for the National Association of Letter Carriers at the union's Bronzeville headquarters Sunday, February 22, 2026. " srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/8b90d1e/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6000x3367+0+316/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fd2%2F2c%2Fe25794db40b1a18d19ecd18f2eb1%2Fnalcrally-260223-05.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/b97d6e0/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6000x3367+0+316/resize/980x550!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fd2%2F2c%2Fe25794db40b1a18d19ecd18f2eb1%2Fnalcrally-260223-05.jpg 2x" width="490" height="275" data-src="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/8b90d1e/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6000x3367+0+316/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fd2%2F2c%2Fe25794db40b1a18d19ecd18f2eb1%2Fnalcrally-260223-05.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" > </picture> <div class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p>Gov. JB Pritzker raises his fist in solidarity next to Elise Foster, president of NALC Branch 11, at a rally kicking off bargaining for the National Association of Letter Carriers at the union’s Bronzeville headquarters. </p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Violet Miller/Sun-Times</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p>An agreement reached in March 2023 is set to expire near the end of May. It brought a new overtime pay structure and protections, increased wages with retroactive pay, cost-of-living adjustments and other changes.</p><p>But last year, then-Postmaster General Louis DeJoy agreed to work with the Department of Government Efficiency, or DOGE, to make sweeping cuts to the postal service’s workforce and budget. DeJoy agreed to cut 10,000 letter carriers from the 640,000-person force and billions of dollars from the USPS budget</p><p>President Donald Trump has also repeatedly called for the privatization of USPS. Former FedEx board member and current Postmaster General David Steiner said he <a class="Link" href="https://apnews.com/article/us-postal-service-usps-steiner-mail-71bab75465eea7a50a065b5868ea96b6" target="_blank" ><u>plans to stay on the same track as DeJoy</u></a><u> </u>after DeJoy stepped down in late March 2025.</p><p>Trump has also waged a war on the unions representing federal workers, signing an executive order last March that said <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/illinois-governor/2025/08/14/jb-pritzker-union-protection-bills-trump-war-federal-unions" target="_blank" ><u>collective bargaining requirements no longer applied</u></a> to many federal agencies, impacting nearly a million employees at the time, according to the American Federation of Government Employees’ national office. Trump said the cancellations were allowed because the agencies, including the Environmental Protection Agency, play a role in national security, a claim that labor groups are disputing in court.</p><p>Trump then canceled contracts for three agencies’ unions, <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/environment/2025/08/12/president-donald-trump-union-contracts-chicago-us-environmental-protection-agency" target="_blank" ><u>stripping union protections</u></a> from EPA workers in August.</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item" data-crop=""> <figure class="Figure"><a class="AnchorLink" id="image-a90001" name="image-a90001"></a> <picture data-crop="medium"> <source type="image/webp" width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/86ebdd6/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5522x3099+0+347/resize/490x275!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fce%2F69%2F36cbc83a44b08d2baf4e580e5f04%2Fnalcrally-260223-07.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/8674589/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5522x3099+0+347/resize/980x550!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fce%2F69%2F36cbc83a44b08d2baf4e580e5f04%2Fnalcrally-260223-07.jpg 2x" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <source width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/d5749cd/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5522x3099+0+347/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fce%2F69%2F36cbc83a44b08d2baf4e580e5f04%2Fnalcrally-260223-07.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <img class="Image" alt="Workers with the National Association of Letter Carriers rally ahead of bargaining for their next contract Sunday, February 22, 2026." srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/d5749cd/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5522x3099+0+347/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fce%2F69%2F36cbc83a44b08d2baf4e580e5f04%2Fnalcrally-260223-07.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/0c6ee9b/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5522x3099+0+347/resize/980x550!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fce%2F69%2F36cbc83a44b08d2baf4e580e5f04%2Fnalcrally-260223-07.jpg 2x" width="490" height="275" data-src="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/d5749cd/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5522x3099+0+347/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fce%2F69%2F36cbc83a44b08d2baf4e580e5f04%2Fnalcrally-260223-07.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" > </picture> <div class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p>Workers with the National Association of Letter Carriers rally ahead of bargaining for their next contract Sunday. Their current contract, signed in 2023, is set to expire in late May.</p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Violet Miller/Sun-Times</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p>Days later, Pritzker signed a state law replacing any repealed federal occupational safety standard with a state standard and ensuring workers are paid the Illinois prevailing wage whenever it is higher than the federal rate when federal construction projects are administered by a state or local government.</p><p>It was one of very few tools for state and local lawmakers looking to back unions against Trump’s gutting of their contracts.</p><p>After being introduced by Mack Julion, the union’s national assistant secretary, as the “48th president of the United States” — drawing a laugh from Pritzker — the governor said the federal government needed to stop working against the union.</p><p>Pritzker mentioned the late civil rights leader<a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/obituaries/2026/02/17/rev-jesse-jackson-civil-rights-leader-rainbow-push-obituary" > Jesse Jackson, who died last week,</a> saying that winning the contract would be the “best way to honor his memory.”</p><p>“The postmaster general needs to do right by you and get you the contract you deserve,” Pritzker said before exiting to chants of "48." “And we’re gonna have to yell it. … Every worker in the United States needs a better wage, so your fight is for them too.”</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item" data-crop=""> <figure class="Figure"><a class="AnchorLink" id="image-370001" name="image-370001"></a> <picture data-crop="medium"> <source type="image/webp" width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/e5a93ee/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5204x2921+0+227/resize/490x275!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F23%2F6e%2Fe4aad3b846808628714d44fafb7a%2Fnalcrally-260223-12.jpg data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <img class="Image" alt="Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker speaks at a rally kicking off bargaining for the  National Association of Letter Carriers at the union's Bronzeville headquarters Sunday, February 22, 2026" srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/b26a79c/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5204x2921+0+227/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F23%2F6e%2Fe4aad3b846808628714d44fafb7a%2Fnalcrally-260223-12.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/bf71dda/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5204x2921+0+227/resize/980x550!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F23%2F6e%2Fe4aad3b846808628714d44fafb7a%2Fnalcrally-260223-12.jpg 2x" width="490" height="275" data-src="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/b26a79c/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5204x2921+0+227/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F23%2F6e%2Fe4aad3b846808628714d44fafb7a%2Fnalcrally-260223-12.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" > </picture> <div class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p> “The postmaster general needs to do right by you and get you the contract you deserve,” Gov. JB Pritzker tells postal workers at a labor rally Sunday at the union’s headquarters in Bronzeville.</p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Violet Miller/Sun-Times</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p></p>
entries.author: Violet Miller

entries.title: Boy, 15, accidentally shot in Morgan Park home
entries.summary: <p>A teenage boy was accidentally shot in a Morgan Park home Sunday, police said.</p><p>The boy, 15, was inside a home in the 11400 block of South Vincennes Avenue when someone he knew accidentally fired a gun, striking him in the leg, according to Chicago police.</p><p>The boy went to Roseland Hospital, where he was listed in good condition.</p><p>The shooter was taken into custody and charges are pending, police said. A gun was recovered at the scene, and detectives are investigating.</p>
entries.author: Sun-Times Wire

entries.title: Bulls' Zach Collins speaks about season-ending toe surgery and his future
entries.summary: <p>In a tough moment, Bulls big man <b>Zach Collins</b> showed his character.</p><p>Collins recently had found out he was headed for season-ending toe surgery and, while lifting weights at the Advocate Center, ran into coach <b>Billy Donovan</b>.</p><p>What did Collins say to Donovan? He apologized. On Sunday, he explained why.</p><p>‘‘I just told him, ‘I’m sorry, man,’ ’’ Collins told the media two days before his scheduled surgery Tuesday. ‘‘I thought I had a lot more to give him this year. Unfortunately, between the wrist and the toe, I just didn’t have a chance to show it.</p><p>‘‘I thought I had a really good summer. I was really looking forward to helping the team. It’s been a frustrating year injury-wise as a whole for the team, but individually I knew I had more to give him and felt like the team would have been in a better spot had I not gone through all these injuries.’’</p><p>Not everyone, however, is a 6-10 big man who plays with the kind of physicality few on the Bulls do.</p><p>That’s why the injury to Collins was so detrimental to what Donovan wanted from the Bulls. All the talk last summer and into fall camp was about ramping up the physicality. Then Collins suffered a wrist injury, came back for 10 games to help the Bulls go 6-4, then suffered the toe injury.</p><p>The Bulls hoped it would be a small setback, but it never improved.</p><p>‘‘We tried to give it every chance we could to get it to heal, and there comes a certain point where you start messing with the outcome of the surgery if you wait too long,’’ Collins said. ‘‘We’re at that point right now. The toe just didn’t get to the point where we wanted it to. We’re at eight weeks now. We just had to kind of bite the bullet and make sure that [even if] we can’t get back this year, we can show everyone that the toe is fine and it’s not going to be a problem in the future.’’</p><p>That is important for Collins to show, given that he will be an unrestricted free agent in July. Donovan said Saturday that Collins would be back if things were up to him, but that’s not his call.</p><p>Collins, however, made it clear where he wants to play next season.</p><p>‘‘I’d love to be back here,’’ Collins said. ‘‘I feel like I came here last year at a time where I was out of the lineup [with the Spurs], and once I got here I was able to play a lot, got a lot of confidence back, got a lot of rhythm. I think the style we play here is just conducive to the success for myself and that I fit in well. I would love to build on that.’’</p><h3>Simons says</h3><p>Guard <b>Anfernee Simons</b> missed the Bulls’ game against the Knicks with an injury to his left wrist suffered Saturday against the Pistons. There is no definitive timetable for his return.</p><p>Simons is scheduled to see a hand specialist and to get imaging done Monday.</p><p>‘‘He’s pretty sore right now,’’ Donovan said. ‘‘They just want to find out what’s going on in the hand.’’</p><h3>Minute men</h3><p>Guards <b>Josh Giddey</b> and <b>Tre Jones</b> and forward <b>Jalen Smith</b> will remain on minutes restrictions as they recover from lower-body injuries. Donovan said all three are supposed to play less than 24 minutes a game.</p>
entries.author: Joe Cowley

entries.title: Horoscope for Monday, February 23, 2026
entries.summary: <h2>Moon Alert</h2> <p>Avoid shopping (except food and gas) or important decisions from 4 p.m. to 9 p.m. After that, the moon in Taurus moves into Gemini.</p><h2>Aries (March 21-April 19)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-4d0000" name="html-embed-module-4d0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>An <b>average</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> Keep an eye on your money and your possessions today because something unexpected could impact them. You might lose money; you might find money. Protect what you own against loss, theft or damage. Pay attention to your moneymaking ideas because they might be worthwhile!</p><h2>Taurus (April 20-May 20)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-7b0000" name="html-embed-module-7b0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>A <b>positive</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> This is an erratic day because the moon is in your sign lined up with wild, wacky Uranus, making you impulsive and wonderfully spontaneous. Be careful because you might do something to offend or threaten an authority figure. Think before you speak.</p><h2>Gemini (May 21-June 20)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-7b0000" name="html-embed-module-7b0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>A <b>positive</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> Steer clear of controversial subjects because they might lead to arguments today. Nevertheless, you're keen to explore new ideas on new subjects and see new places to learn new things. (Ever curious, you love the fascination of new knowledge.)</p><h2>Cancer (June 21-July 22)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-7b0000" name="html-embed-module-7b0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>A <b>positive</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> A busy day! A friend or a member of a group might surprise you by saying or doing something you least expect. Or perhaps you'll meet someone new who is unusual and interesting. Steer clear of disputes about inheritances, shared property and shared expenses. (You don't need the angst.)</p><h2>Leo (July 23-Aug. 22)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-4d0000" name="html-embed-module-4d0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>An <b>average</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> Tread carefully when dealing with authority figures today — bosses, parents, teachers, VIPs and the police — because something unexpected might catch you off guard. Someone might do or say something you didn't anticipate. "Nobody expects the Spanish Inquisition!"</p><h2>Virgo (Aug. 23-Sept. 22)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-7b0000" name="html-embed-module-7b0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>A <b>positive</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> Travel plans might change today. They might be delayed or canceled — or perhaps you suddenly have to travel when you didn't expect to do so. Likewise, school schedules might also change. Stay on top of details regarding medicine, the law and publishing.</p><h2>Libra (Sept. 23-Oct. 22)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-4d0000" name="html-embed-module-4d0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>An <b>average</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> An unexpected dispute with your kids might occur today, especially about money or financial support. A surprise might happen in the arts or anything to do with sports. Don't let a partner, spouse or close friend put you down or make you feel diminished. You're doing the best you can.</p><h2>Scorpio (Oct. 23-Nov. 21)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-7b0000" name="html-embed-module-7b0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>A <b>positive</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> This is a busy, playful day even though friction at home might occur, especially with partners and spouses. Give yourself extra time so you have wiggle room to deal with the unexpected. You want to enjoy this day — not be frustrated. Stay chill.</p><h2>Sagittarius (Nov. 22-Dec. 21)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-4d0000" name="html-embed-module-4d0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>An <b>average</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> Pay attention to everything you say and do today because this is a mildly accident-prone day. Obviously, an accident doesn't have to happen; however, if you're distracted by something — that nanosecond could make you vulnerable. Be alert. (The world needs more lerts.)</p><h2>Capricorn (Dec. 22-Jan. 19)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-7b0000" name="html-embed-module-7b0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>A <b>positive</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> Disputes about money or shared expenses for a social occasion, a vacation or something related to the education and support of your kids might arise today. Don't overreact. Take time to do your homework so that your response is sensible and practical. Short trips and conversations will be appealing today.</p><h2>Aquarius (Jan. 20-Feb. 18)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-7b0000" name="html-embed-module-7b0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>A <b>positive</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> Your home routine might be interrupted today. Small appliances could break down, or a little breakage could occur. Someone unexpected might knock at your door. Get dressed so that you're ready for anything. Avoid arguments because they will drain you unnecessarily. Keep the peace.</p><h2>Pisces (Feb. 19-March 20)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-4d0000" name="html-embed-module-4d0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>An <b>average</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> You're definitely strong, gracious and charming with the sun, Mercury and fair Venus in your sign. Admittedly, Mercury is about to go retrograde this week, making you forget things, misplace items and run a bit late. Transportation delays are also likely. Avoid arguments today. Keep smiling.</p><h2>If today is your birthday</h2><p>Actress Emily Blunt (1983) shares your birthday today. You are practical, determined and tenacious. You have analytical abilities and can project confidence. Lucky you! This year you will reap the benefits of your hard work. Expect power and leadership. It's a year for major decisions and accomplishments. You will receive awards or kudos and acknowledgments from others.</p>
entries.author: Georgia Nicols

entries.title: 'They've been calling me to come back': Angel Reese talks return to Unrivaled
entries.summary: <p><a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/chicago-sky" target="_blank" >Sky</a> star Angel Reese has spent the offseason away from basketball, but basketball kept calling. And calling. And calling.</p><p>Unrivaled, the 3x3 startup league founded by Breanna Stewart and Napheesa Collier, <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/chicago-sky/2026/02/11/angel-reese-rejoins-3x3-league-unrivaled-with-mid-season-deal" >wanted their megastar back</a>.</p><p>"From the first day Unrivaled started, they've been calling me to come back," Reese said after a win on Sunday night, her second game back with the club.</p><p>At first, Reese <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/chicago-sky/2025/10/30/angel-reese-will-not-return-for-unriva" >opted out of Unrivaled for the league’s second season</a>, which began in January. But as the season has progressed, she's fielded calls from the league's coaches, players, and of course, her Rose BC teammates, who were champions in the league's inaugural season.</p><p>They all wanted Reese back.</p><p>"She's Rose basketball," teammate Kahleah Copper said of Reese. "The culture we created was on her back."</p><p>Reese eventually obliged. She signed a deal with Unrivaled to play the final three games of the season.</p><p>Rose BC is lucky she had the time. Reese has been everywhere this WNBA offseason, from modeling in the Victoria Secret fashion show to booking acting gigs on the popular Netflix series "The Hunting Wives." Most recently she went on a promotional tour in Australia for her signature shoe, the AR1s.</p><p></p><p>"Literally I was in Australia and they were like 'You want to come back?'" Reese said. "I was like, 'alright.' Literally I was on the beach last week, and now I'm here."</p><p>Reese said she hasn't played basketball in months. In her first two games back with Rose BC, it was like she never left. She's averaging her typical double-double, including a 15-rebound performance against the Laces. With that win, Rose BC clinched the playoffs.</p><p>Should Rose BC advance to the Semifinals, they'll play at Barclays Center on March 2 in a double-header.</p>
entries.author: Alissa Hirsh

entries.title: Bulls stay competitive against Knicks before losing ninth game in a row
entries.summary: <p>There will come a point this season when Bulls coach Billy Donovan finally pulls back on the chase for ‘‘competitive integrity’’ and no longer will be concerned about trying to squeeze out victories.</p><p>Mark it down for about 10 p.m. April 12.</p><p>That’s about the time the Bulls will have played their final game of the regular season in Dallas and are loading up for the plane ride home.</p><p>Forget about it happening before that.</p><p>Donovan made that clear again Sunday. Even after the Bulls fell to the Knicks 105-99 for their ninth consecutive loss, their longest skid since January 2019, he wasn’t going to change his stance about competitiveness over development.</p><p>‘‘From a locker-room standpoint and going in there every single day as professionals that take their job seriously, to go in there and say, ‘Listen, guys, we’re not even trying,’ or, ‘Hey, we’re going to do this, this and this,’ I have not gotten that,’’ Donovan said. ‘‘So he’s not available to play [right now], but let’s see how Jaden [Ivey] can help the group. Or how Rob [Dillingham] can help the group. But our intention is to go out there and try and win every single night. It’s been a challenge from the standpoint of trying to get all these guys on the same page.’’</p><p>There is a method to Donovan’s madness, however.</p><p>While it became obvious the Bulls didn’t have the horsepower to keep up with the Knicks, especially late, Donovan’s feeling is that force-feeding the idea of staying competitive — undermanned or not — is allowing development to happen. That specifically goes for forward Matas Buzelis.</p><p>‘‘It’s been a lot harder on Matas, but I think in a good way,’’ Donovan said. ‘‘When Coby [White] was here and Ayo [Dosunmu] was here and ‘Vooch’ [Nikola Vucevic] was here, even though [Buzelis] got into the starting lineup, he’s now starting to see the best defenders in the league night in and night out. I think that’s a great opportunity for him to make a jump because he’s starting to learn a lot.</p><p>‘‘The consistency of being able to perform at a really high level against really good defenders and good players is something he’s kind of gotten thrust into, and I do think that because of his makeup and competitiveness, how much he leans into that, that could really help him.’’</p><p>Maybe it will someday soon, but it didn’t help late against the Knicks. While Buzelis finished with 15 points, he had two good looks on three-pointers with the game in reach and just more than two minutes left. He missed both.</p><p>And while this latest loss didn’t feature the kind of meltdown the Bulls endured in the third quarter 24 hours earlier against the Pistons, it was another reminder of why the Knicks are competing for a top-four playoff spot in the Eastern Conference and the Bulls (24-34) are doing what they can to improve their lottery odds.</p><p>The culprit was a familiar one. Turnovers gave the Knicks an opportunity to take control of the game in the third quarter, opening a 13-point lead. The Bulls turned the ball over seven times in the quarter.</p><p>To their credit, however, the Bulls came back and made a game of it. But the result still wasn’t good enough.</p><p>‘‘We’ve got to find ways to be way more competitive,’’ said guard Josh Giddey, who shot 2-for-10 from the field and scored six points. ‘‘It starts with that first unit. We’ve got to set the tone. But we’ve got to find ways, one through 15, to get this thing on the right track.’’</p>
entries.author: Joe Cowley
